content.description:
<math alttext="4 F e S, solid, plus 7 O 2, gas, react to produce 2 F e 2 O 3, solid, plus 4 S O 2, gas" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>F</mtext><mtext>e</mtext><mtext>S</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>+</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>7</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>→</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>F</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>e</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>+</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>4</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>S</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

Due to the presence of <math alttext="F e S, solid" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>F</mtext><mtext>e</mtext><mtext>S</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> as an impurity, the combustion of some types of coal results in the formation of <math alttext="S O 2, gas" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>S</mtext><mtext></mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, as represented by the equation above. Also, <math alttext="S O 2, gas" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>S</mtext><mtext></mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> can react with <math alttext="O 3, gas" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> to form <math alttext="S O 3, gas" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>S</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, as represented by the equation below.

<math alttext="S O 2 gas plus O 3 gas, are in equilibrium with S O 3 gas plus O 2 gas" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>S</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>+</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>⇄</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>S</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>+</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math><math alttext="Delta H naught sub 298, equals negative 242 kilojoules per mole reaction; delta S naught sub 298, equals negative 25 joules per kelvin mole reaction" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>∆</mo><msubsup><mi>H</mi><mn>298</mn><mo>∘</mo></msubsup><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>242</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">k</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi><mo>/</mo><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi></mrow><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mstyle></msub><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>;</mo><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>∆</mtext><msubsup><mi>S</mi><mn>298</mn><mo>∘</mo></msubsup><mo>=</mo><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mn>25</mn></mpadded><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>J/</mtext><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi mathvariant="normal">K</mi><mo>·</mo><msub><mi>mol</mi><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math>
content.question: Which of the following is most likely to be true about the reaction between <math alttext="S O 2, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mi>S</mi><msub><mrow><mi>O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mstyle><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="O 3, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><msub><mrow><mi>O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mstyle><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="298 kelvin" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>298</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">K</mi></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="delta G naught, is less than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>G</mi><mi>°</mi><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></math> and <math alttext="T delta S naught" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mi>T</mi></mstyle><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>∘</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is smaller in magnitude than <math alttext="delta H naught" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msup><mrow><mi>H</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>∘</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="delta G naught, is less than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>G</mi><mi>°</mi><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></math> and <math alttext="T delta S naught" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow></mstyle><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msup><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>∘</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> is larger in magnitude than <math alttext="delta H naught" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msup><mrow><mi>H</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>∘</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="delta G naught, is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>G</mi><mi>°</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></math> and <math alttext="T delta S naught" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow></mstyle><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msup><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>∘</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> is smaller in magnitude than <math alttext="delta H naught" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msup><mrow><mi>H</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>∘</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="delta G naught, is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>G</mi><mi>°</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></math> and <math alttext="T delta S naught" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow></mstyle><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msup><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>∘</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> is larger in magnitude than <math alttext="delta H naught" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msup><mrow><mi>H</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>∘</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: <math alttext="delta G naught, is less than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>G</mi><mi>°</mi><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></math> and <math alttext="T delta S naught" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mi>T</mi></mstyle><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>∘</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is smaller in magnitude than <math alttext="delta H naught" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msup><mrow><mi>H</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>∘</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>.

topic.text: 9.3: Gibbs Free Energy and Thermodynamic Favorability

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
